question: Question_04_(a)
statement:
Given a differentiable function $\displaystyle f$, recall that there are
two definitions for $\displaystyle f'(a)$ :

\[\displaystyle f'(a) = \lim_{x \to a} \frac{f(x) - f(a)}{x - a}\]

and

\[\displaystyle f'(a) = \lim_{h \to 0}\frac{f(a+h) - f(a)}{h}\]

Pick one of these definitions and draw a picture to illustrate the fact
that the limit on the right-hand side is the limit of slopes of secant
lines. Make sure to include the labels $a$ and $f(a)$.
hints:
Draw an \emph{a} and \emph{x} (or an \emph{x} and an \emph{x + h}) on
the x-axis. Given a drawing of a function $f$, what are the
corresponding labels on the y-axis?
